text: Sapa'u Ruperake Petaia (born 11 April 1951) is a Samoan poet and writer. He is known for writing about the effects of colonialism and Western influences on Samoan culture and society. Petaia was born in Samoa, and studied at the University of South Pacific in Fiji. A collection of his poems called Blue Rain was published in 1980 (among them the poem "Kidnapped").
